intro: Windmannia ovata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in the summer months. Windmannia ovata is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
